Entries.default:
"Well, hello there!"

The woman greets you with a cheery smile, the effect of which is marred somewhat by her only having half a face. She scrubs, unperturbed, at some glasses.

"Guessing you just came in."

As she speaks, you notice a strange mark upon her forehead - a kind of symbol, or rune.
"You mean you... don't want to eat me?"

"What? That some kind of joke, sweetheart? 

"Well, we welcome all sorts here. This is a peaceful town, and we've no cause to start any trouble with anyone."

"Always happy to see new faces. We're a long ways from everywhere, and not many folk are so keen to risk the voyage. 

"You're just in time for the harvest."
"Now, calm down, sweetheart. You've been out on the sea too long, I reckon. Caught yourself some sunstroke, maybe."

"Might be you'll feel more polite once you've had some rest and refreshment. Come by then."

Shaking her head, she turns away.
"Help yourself to some ale while you're waiting. Zulka ought to be here soon with the day's catch."
"Good to see you again. Thinking of staying on?"
"Have a drink, love, it'll ease your mind."

"What? Have I got something on..." 

She turns her glass, frowning at her reflection. Seeing nothing of note, she shrugs and gives you a wry look.
"Looks like we have someone new in town."
